ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] getting started
ygData.msgSnippet: Speaking of backpacks, the inkies have a few quests that give you containers to complete. You can get 5 containers (that I know of) and 3 of them are 10
ygData.messageBody:
Speaking of backpacks, the inkies have a few quests that give you containers
to complete. You can get 5 containers (that I know of) and 3 of them are 10
slotters.
luv,
-Su


At the first, you have no cash to buy backpacks, no extra junk to
carry....that's a plus, IMO. I never could keep my monk under weight anyway,
she hovers at 28 or so bc I couldn't resist a bit of twinking. Ah
well...for the weaponry she packs, it's worth it.
----- Original Message -----
From: erik
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, June 17, 2002 8:00 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] getting started


> From: "The Mad Macinchaote" <scendera@...>
>
> Druids and monks are excellent first chars, as are pallies and warriors.

I would suggest not starting out with a monk, as their weight restriction
would be fairly tough for a first time player to deal with

Erik Johnson
